page.title: 06A FAMILY FIRM IN STAMBOURNE
page.content: The haulage company of E.A.Pyman & Sons was founded in 1936 by Mr.E.A. Pyman. The main business in those days was with a cattle float carrying live- stock: most farms then had livestock. During the war the land girls were ferried about as well. Gradually, as less farms had livestock and the farms became more arable, the emphasis in haulage was towards grain. Today the lorries carry bulk grain. Occasionally coal or animal feeds are carried. The firm has 7 Volvo F7 lorries. Two of these have 25 tonnes carrying capacity, the others are 20 tonnes. They carry the bulk grain from farm to either flour mills or Intervention Store or to the docks.Nowadays, carrying bulk grain is not seasonal. They employ 7 drivers who live locally. The longest serving driver has worked for them for 8 years.
